snippet.title: Case of terror-plot accused men in court
snippet.content: The case of two Sydney men accused of plotting to bring down an Etihad plane will be back in court in November. A lawyer for Khaled Mahmoud Khayat, 49, of Lakemba and Mahmoud Khayat, 32, of Punchbowl, told a magistrate at Parramatta Local Court on Friday that he did not require the men to be shown on the audio-visual link screen. They are each charged with two counts of acting in preparation for, or planning, a terrorist act. The case was adjourned to the same court on November 14. (C) AAP 2017
